website_summaries.verdict: The Yamaha RX-V671 sounds excellent and supports several high-quality streaming-music services, but it lacks built-in AirPlay support.
pros: The Yamaha RX-V671 has excellent sound quality and six HDMI inputs, including a handy front-panel input
It has a solid collection of built-in streaming-music apps including Pandora, Rhapsody, and Sirius XM
And while the user interface isn't great compared with other home theater components, it's one of the best available on AV receivers
cons: Also, the similar Onkyo TX-NR609 costs about $100 less, although it doesn't sound quite as good
No Wi-Fi dongle is available, either, although there are plenty of solid workarounds

customer_reviews.title: Works Great Except the Remote
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in 2011. Works great except now, the power button has difficulty working unless you hold it down for 3 or 4 seconds. Everything else is fine. Use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Mac007

customer_reviews.title: No hdmi video out anymore
customer_reviews.text: Cant use hdmi for video out anymore. Purchased in 2012 and now the hdmi output to the tv makes it pretty useless as a home theater receiver. Since all the zone 2 and set up menu is done on the TV screen it makes it pretty well impossible to set the receiver. I've been reading it's a problem with this unit that circuitboard for the HDMI goes out and it cost more than the receiver is worth. It's a shame because it still a perfect receiver just about useless though for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Stingray240

customer_reviews.title: Incredible for $370
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a ten year old receiver that was all optical, stereo RCA and component video. Putting this Yamaha in with DirectTV/DVR, AppleTV, Blu-Ray and setting up the speakers took 15 minutes with HDMI (and most of that was prepping new speaker wire). And OMG, iTunes match with AppleTV made even connecting an iPod/iPhone irrelevant unless friends bring over their own music. The iPod interface DOES require that you use a TV to control your music when using the standard USB cable interface (not mentioned in any specs I read before purchasing). I do not know how the YDS-12 dock from Yamaha functions. Tiny little buttons on the remote but you can see that in the picture of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Carl in Katy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This is a higher end mid range receiver. It delivers a crisp sound in every register. Really full, great setup using the microphone to balance your system, and all controlled with an iPhone and iPad app. That is one of my favorite features. AirPlay isn't supported out of the box, but if you connect an Apple TV to it like others have stated, it is just as simple as selecting the Apple TV using AirPlay on your Mac or iOS device. Overall, this is hands down the best receiver I have ever had. Quality, and well worth it. (paired with Jamo speakers (made by klipsch), polk psw 10 sub, Apple TV, all digital optical connections.)
customer_reviews.author: begoldn

customer_reviews.title: A childhood dream comes true.
customer_reviews.text: When I was a youngin' I always wanted a Yamaha receiver. I put down the hippie lettuce just long enough to finish school and it is amazing what money can buy. This receiver is a dream and was a little tricky for this old lady to set up but the help line was just incredible. My crap runs really well together.I enjoy this receiver with my Polk speakers and my big ass Samsung TV because I work everyday now and can afford it. I have Apple TV also and this receiver was made for it. I bought the Yamaha subwoofer with it and baby my crib goes boom boom. Self discipline is getting what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Ann Broadus

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha receiver
customer_reviews.text: This receiver was sent back after hooking it up and finding that the Zone two speakers did not function. They are the speaker hook- ups that can be used from a different source than the one being used directly from the unit. In other words while someone is watching TV in the living room using the receiver, someone else can be listening to CD music on the deck from the same Yamaha receiver. This is a feature that I really like but unfortunately it didn't work on this receiver as it was designed to do. Also I found that the speaker wire hook ups were not the quality I was used to on my old Onkyo.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you want great quality sound then this is the system that you ...
customer_reviews.text: Let me tell you. This is the system of all systems. Do not even consider a bose. If you want great quality sound then this is the system that you need. I had this system in my 2,400 sq. ft. clothing store and I could not believe the quality sound this system put out. It was amazing. Save your money and buy this great system.
customer_reviews.author: Perry Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Awesome piece of mid-grade equipment
customer_reviews.text: I had an older Yamaha for many years until one day I found I had too much money, so I decided to upgrade to a Denon in an attempt to improve my listening experience. Mistake! That overpriced Denon completely sucked in my opinion, so I bought this Yamaha on one of Amazon's Christmas special deals. I love it! It performs so much better than the overpriced Denon. I love the Network Connection. Great for Pandora. Unless you are some crazed and/or overly wealthy audiophile, you will definately get your money's worth and satisfaction out of this receiver. I do recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: bwan

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice AV Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to update to all HDMI receiver, have been waiting and watching for a few years, this is a Great AV Receiver, all features work as advertised, free iOS app really nice addition with Yamaha wireless adapter (bought seperately). Did take some searching thru menus to turn on HDMI pass thru (a necessity for the technically challenged in your household). Good value for the price as well. Am passing output through actiontec wireless hdmi (my wireless TV) to TVs in kitchen and back porch - works well and syncs without a problem, zone two audio hooked up to 5.8ghz wireless beaming sound to speakers throughout house and yard.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Easy for technically challenged
customer_reviews.text: OK I admit it, I am not the most technical person. I just want to listen to music, not spend hours setting up a receiver to allow that to happen. I purchased my previous receiver while stationed in Germany in 1968. I connected the speakers (only 2) that I also purchased at the PX, following all the directions and everything worked right away - to my relief and mild amazement. The automated process that the Yamaha uses to listen to your speakers was really easy and made it all sound really great. I admit I am no audiophile, but I am super pleased with the results and low effort to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Scott

customer_reviews.title: Straightforward setup, decent UI, good picture/sound
customer_reviews.text: I picked this because of the large number of HDMI inputs, network features and UI features. Image and sound quality is good, and the automated room profile process seems to work quite well - the vast majority of time we use it for TV viewing from Cable, BluRay and streaming sources. Internet radio works well enough, though navigation is a little clunky in places. For some reason it can't play any of my Media Center material (music library, movies) where a PS3 can. HDMI switched picture seems especially crisp and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Need help with rear speakers
customer_reviews.text: I love this unit but not sure why I'm not getting much sound out of my rear speakers. I have a all definitive tech speakers. Two front towers, a sub, and two rear in ceiling. Can someone please possibly help with what setting to have this on. I think I'm using 5.1 pro logic now? As you can see I'm no expert. I watch mostly HD programming on Directv, Netflix and some PS3 games and movies but I hardly ever hear the rears kick on. And when they do it seems pretty faint. I know they're hooked up correctly because when I run through the test mode they are (the rears) are loud and clear. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Sir Spend a Lot

customer_reviews.title: Overall pretty nice
customer_reviews.text: My only real complaint is the receiver is a little slow to change inputs. It goes into a pass through mode when it is turned off so the signal is still available to the television. The OSD seems to be a little clunky but I dont know if I have seen an OSD that I really like so that is not a knock against this unit or Yamaha.The auto setup seems to work pretty good - it located the distance to my speakers and adjusted its self accordingly, it even detected that I had one of the surround speakers hooked up out of phase (backwards).
customer_reviews.author: B. Snelgrove

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: i bought this Yamaha RX-V671 7.1-Channel Audio/Video Receiver to replace an older model now that everything is hdmi. i think it sounds great. my only issue is the sound from the hdmi from my video card occasionally disappears although that might be the video cards fault. enjoy this product. *update* i found that as long as i power up the reciever first and let it switch all the way on, then turn on the tv, it works great. of course if i have to restart my computer, i must turn the tv off until the computer is all the way on and the reciever is back to showing dolby.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Nice equipment
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile but I am very impressed by this receiver. It runs smooth and quiet, and barely generates any heat while producing great output for my floor-speaker pair. I enjoy the iPod/USB connectivity on the front panel, and the Android app on my phone let's me control the receiver through my wireless network. It feels pretty awesome to be accessing my entire music library on my iPod through my phone in another room. Highly recommended product, I got it for less than $300 on Black Friday and I'm glad I hopped on Amazon for such a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Big Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a Thanksgiving Day special! It doesn't have wi-fi, but the price was right. I love having on-screen set up and one HDMI cable to the TV. I run my DirecTV box, AppleTV, PS3, and DVD player through this using the HDMI inputs. Easy set up with my 5.1, and upgradable to 7.1 sound. We use the surround sound a lot more now that we have a good receiver. My old one was a Yamaha, and it was great, but at least 13 years old (still going strong in another room) and no HDMI.
customer_reviews.author: macG

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when it was on sale for black Friday in 2012 and I am very glad I did. This replaced a Sony receiver which failed on me after a year. (HDMI board went out) This has plenty of features and settings that you can personalize your experience. Just had an update on in it through the Ethernet and that took only 15minutes or so, Sadly you cannot do a single thing while it does its update even running through bypass mode. Also I do wish they offered more internet radio services .
customer_reviews.author: MAK

customer_reviews.title: Just right for a regular user
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this receiver to benefit from the hdmi which was lacking in my last receiver. It took me about 15 minutes to hook it up. No manual but it comes with a CD. A little inconvienent but seems to be the trend these days. I'm a newbie at this kind of stuff but within a while figured most of it out. The only real problem that I didn't anticipate was that the newer receivers need a powered subwoofer which I did not have. My old system had just a wired sub, something to think about. Subwoofer's aren't cheap. I can now handle almost everything with the Yamaha remote. Pretty happy.
customer_reviews.author: JM1145

customer_reviews.title: I love it!!
customer_reviews.text: great sound quality. I love the audio enhancer feature. I found it easy to setup without looking in the manual. I wanted to get a remote extender so I could put the receiver lower out of sight but the customer service was not inclined to sell or help me get an extention cord that I could plug into the back of the AVR. I have a 5.1 setup with zone 2 setup with outdoor speakers on the back patio. All polk audio speakers.
customer_reviews.author: MTBrider

customer_reviews.title: best receiver I have ever purchased!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love yamaha! After going through countless brands of receivers of the last couple of decades, I must say Yamaha is deff the best one you can buy. It provides extremely powerful sound output, as well as have a lot of features. Plus, its pretty easy to understand what everything does, as the instructions are fantastic. If you're looking for a great, high quality receiver that will last, look no further!
customer_reviews.author: atomicdp

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: This unit replaced an older Sony that died after only a few year's use. It has a working HDMI function and the best part is the auto set-up for the room and speaker array. It comes with a microphone that automatically adjusts the output for the room and speakers during set-up. Plenty of power and versatility for all kinds of programs. Great sound and affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Ruback

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Our old receiver finally died on us after many faithful years of service. So, when we were looking to upgrade, we needed a receiver that could handle multiple inputs/outputs (tv, blue-ray, cable box, Roku, Wii, etc) and also wanted one that had the ability to hook up to our wireless network. This seems to fit the bill and has been working great. Does everything we need and works with our all-in-one remote.
customer_reviews.author: Texarkana

customer_reviews.title: Receiver
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this receiver. I have had it for about 2 months with no issues. It replaced an RX-V467 that I had for about 2 years with no problems. I just decided to move up to 7.1 and Internet capabilities. Sold the 467 and got a great deal on this 671. Didnt care for the YPAO setup which I ran 3 times and got 3 different setups. I just set it up manually and it sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Bond

customer_reviews.title: excellent sound, good size, plenty of connections
customer_reviews.text: terrible remote control. we love the sound quality and the second zone is great. However, the second zone doesn't work with any hdmi connection feed and the remote changes codes each use - this is a TERRIBLE feature for modern equipment. Yes, it is supposed to be a good feature. BUT, you try controlling this unit with anything other than it's own remote and you will understand the meaning of frustration.
customer_reviews.author: beninmariettaga

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the unit. I chose it over similar RX-V571 for its ability to upconvert the signal from both HDMI and component sources + ability to control the receiver from the iOS app. Well, the quality of video and audio out of the unit is great for my non-professional taste. My mistake was that the unit does not have built-in WiFi support, so idea controlling it with iPhone did not work out for me. It can be remedied by a separate WiFi-Ethernet adapter, but after connecting smart DVD player and using unit's own remote, I am not missing ability to control the AV receiver with the help of the app much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned this receiver for my Onkyo
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, i'm not sure why this receiver is so highly rated. I bought this receiver to replace my broken Onkyo SR608 non network receiver but promptly returned it once I received my Onkyo back from the warranty repair. While this unit has all the right features, for me, the sound just wasn't there. I much prefer the Audyssey technology with the front high speaker configuration. The menu options were also very confusing and not nearly as configurable as the Onkyo. Had to be so negative but definitely try to listen to this unit prior to purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I use this product with Onkyo 7.1 surround sound speakers and it works beautifully. I would highly recommend this for anyone that is interested in a home theater system, but doesn't want to break the bank. This is my first receiver and I am highly pleased after almost 8 months of use. The setup was easy and it has a mic system that auto-adjusts the sound levels for optimal performance.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew LaClair

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this "used" from the Amazon Marketplace. Since it was an old model, it was a fraction of the cost, but did everthing I wanted it to do. The box looked new and had NO signs it had been opened. The sound is awesome! I love using the App to control it, and to play Pandora. The only thing I can't figure out is that some songs that are on my iPhone are greyed out and not available to be played through the receiver. Not sure why, but this is a small issue for me. Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.author: B-rad

customer_reviews.title: Great system for the price. Could be a little better
customer_reviews.text: Sleek and sexy design with ample HDMI ports and a good selection of inputs. Sound quality is great but I have a consern with the picture and lack of adjustments in video. This device does get in between your hardware so it does have a effect on thier performance. Have it hooked up in line with a blu- ray and 240ghz led, going to run direct to the tv and see if there is any difference. Wil post again if there is
customer_reviews.author: Big guy 77

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver, lots of bells and whistles
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS RECEIVER! Upgraded after lightening took out my old one. Was torn about upgrading to the v671 just for the second zone and network capability, but glad I did. Being able to stream pandora and music from my computers is great. Receiver is very easy to use and for the money, this receiver was well worth it. Can't wait for next summer to hook up my outdoor speakers and use the second zone!
customer_reviews.author: WL

customer_reviews.title: Older Version but excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this receiver that I will buy another Yamaha when the time comes. It has the best sound, comes with Pandora and a bunch of other music options. I can control it through my web browser if I need to. The only thing I wish I had was bluetooth connectivity, but for the price I paid, I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Lando C

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: We are moving to a new house with theater speakers pre installed. This receiver was one recommended by the electronics person who will be installing the in wall system. He was giving me a price of $525.00. I purchased it on a Deal of the day for $299.00. It has all the features all the features I need and then some. I guess it is safe to say I love it.
customer_reviews.author: jurgen figenser

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Yamaha RX-V671BL AV Receiver I am absolutely excited over the sound that comes from this receiver. I am exceptionally pleased on how easy it was to set up--especially with the microphone set up that automatically adjust the speakers. With my old system, we could barely hear the rear speakers. Now, they absolutely complete my surround sound.
customer_reviews.author: RRJR

customer_reviews.title: Oh My What a Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best receiver since owning two Sony Receivers in my past. Great digital sound and I love all the HDMI inputs and HDMI output to TV makes even the 480 DVDs look BluRay. I 'm amazed at the sound and all the functions this receiver has for the price. I've looked everywhere and this one was $100 less with Free shipping! I'm just amazed! I'm glad I got this before Amazon started charging tax in my state. I am so happy with the entire purchase! THANK YOU YAMAHA and Amazon [please go back to tax free]!
customer_reviews.author: D. Grey

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Model sent
customer_reviews.text: This is advertised as an RX-V671 Yamaha Receiver, but they sent the newer RX-V685 model. The RX-V685 model does not support IPOD functionality. Sent back and received a prompt refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great amp
customer_reviews.text: Great amp. All works as expected and sounds fantastic. This is a 120V version, even though the picture shows a worldwide version (100-240V), so I have to use it with a transformer 240V-120V but at half the price of the local suppliers in Australia it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: MyfordMan

customer_reviews.title: A/V Receiver
customer_reviews.text: I have not owned one receiver before but I am not regretting buying this product. I wanted a receiver that is network-enabled and can connect to my NAS device. This fits perfectly my want. The fact that I can connect to some Internet radio station was also a plus. I am enjoying every minute of using this receiver. It did not work well though with the speakers I had with my previous home theater speakers especially as the subwoofer was not powered. I am planning to buy a recommended speaker system
customer_reviews.author: Babatunde AKANNI

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in May 2012. First impression was "fantastic". Great sound quality, lots of features, plenty of HDMI inputs and a competitive price. I thought it was my best receiver ever, until June 2014, when it quit working. I also have a 20 year-old Kenwood in the spare room still working fine. I have an Onkyo on order as a replacement. The yamaha repair shop is 1-1/2 hours away.....haven't decided if it belongs in the shop or the landfill.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Gaines

customer_reviews.title: High quality receiver - Poor Owner's Manual
customer_reviews.text: The receiver is very high quality. The sound output is without distortion and the receiver stays cool. The on screen interface is also straightforward and easy to use. I like the multiple HDMI ports which make's the Yamaha very easy to hook up to my Samsung LED, Blu Ray and cable box. I would give this five stars but the owner's manual only comes on a CD. This is unacceptable for a product that has multiple features requiring you to have to run to the computer when you have a question. Thus I give it 4.5 stars. All in all though you cannot go wrong with this receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I've enjoyed the amazing sound with my wonderful speakers, and have all my components going through it. I loaded nearly my whole library of MP3s (and it's a very large library) onto that 16 g zip and it plays with wonderful separation and detail. This is exactly what I've been wanting! Can't say enough good about this product!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Karren

customer_reviews.title: A great receiver
customer_reviews.text: It does everything I want a receiver to do: more than enough ports for all my media, plays things like pandora without needing external plugins, outputs great sound, and is easy to use. A great purchase for not too much money.
customer_reviews.author: Derigible

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha RX-V671 7.1-Channel Network AV Receiver
customer_reviews.text: I really only use one function and that is surround sound for TV and movies. This unit has so many more features. It was easy to set up and I think it sounds great. I'm no expert so I don't think you should take my advice. I bought this unit because it was reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Red Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: I have worked mine.
customer_reviews.text: two and a half years in and it has been one and pumping for most of it's life. I still don't know how load it will go. I haven't been to 100 and I know that isn't the highest. That is set in the setup menu. I goes much louder after adjustment. I'll never do that.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph Steadmiller

customer_reviews.title: Awesome AV Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a month and it works great with a 2 tower speaker setup. Love the passive hdmi pass through so I don't have to leave it on to keep energy use down. 1080p upscale is a cool feature for dvds, but it shrinks the picture area when I connect my htpc via hdmi since my plasma tv is only 720p and I cannot fix it, so I just connect htpc to directly to my tv. Overall, the receiver has performed as expected.
customer_reviews.author: diapermom

customer_reviews.title: It give me great surround sound !
customer_reviews.text: I connected 7 Bose cube speakers and Pioneer subwoofer to it, it makes great surround sound. Only thing I got little trouble is that the receiver has one female outlet for subwoofer, but my Pioneer subwoofer has left and right connections, I have to buy a one male to two male cable to connect them.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Z.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design, build, features
customer_reviews.text: For me, Yahama music electronics work. Perform as advertised. This one is confounding in trying to configure second zone audio. Telephone help was impatient for good reason: the guy didn't know the product. Too bad. I would gladly have given five stars with competent coaching to resolve this one set-up hiccup.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with DirecTV remotes
customer_reviews.text: I like to use one remote for everything, and my DirecTV remotes have been decent at doing that for some while. However with this receiver I cannot change inputs between anything useful with those remotes (like HDMI1 and HDMI2).
customer_reviews.author: cheap

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Finally I settled on this receiver. Love the onscreen menu, works and sets up flawlessly and sounds beautiful.But... I was kind of disappointed when I realized that DLNA feature in the receiver supports only audio files and it does not stream video or photos.
customer_reviews.author: Ramp

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and Android App is great
customer_reviews.text: Have this connected in a 5.0 set up currently (no sub) and it is working great. Great sound after I ran YPAO. Only issue I have is when trying to stream music from my phone to the receiver using the Yamaha app (other apps work fine currently using Bubbleupnp). Changing input without having to turn on the receiver is a nice feature - just need to select the input you want with the remote not with the physical buttons on the receiver's face. I would recommend this receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Phil C

customer_reviews.title: Some features great, but overall I'm disappointed
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost the HDMI out port failed in less than 1 year. Second, I bought it because it offers the ability to run one set of surround speakers as a "B" set of speakers. But this channel will not run the ipod and it feels like you need to spend days of intense studying in the manual just to learn how to operate the darn thing
customer_reviews.author: Blueacresman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Receiver
customer_reviews.text: The receiver is good but has a few flaws. 1) the universal electrical cord is only a two prong one instead of three prong. The receiver does not have the power I was looking for similar to a RX-v1. The receiver is very clean amplifier and impressed with all advanced features.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo F Bolanos

customer_reviews.title: VERY happy
customer_reviews.text: I am EXTREMELY please with this receiver. The sound quality is outstanding, excellent connectivity options, the video through HDMI is just outstanding. I am using the Yamaha application from the Android Play Store to control and customize. I could not be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Campmaster Tom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent receiver
customer_reviews.text: I just took delivery of this receiver a few days ago, and I really like it. It's replacing an ancient Maranatz gold receiver that can't handle the newer connections like iPod, HDMI, etc. The Yamaha is basically ready to go out of the box and delivers great sound quality. Currently, I'm using Bose 901s and this receiver really pushes them to their best. I really like the connectivity it has with my iPod. Very intuitive and fast. I will update this review over time, as I marry the Yamaha to the BluRay, TV, Sirius, etc. over time. However, I think we're off to a great start.
customer_reviews.author: Blackstone

customer_reviews.title: This has been a good receiver for a couple of years
customer_reviews.text: This has been a good receiver for a couple of years. This is not as good of sound quality as my previous Onkyo receiver was. I would probably spend more money someday on another Onkyo.
customer_reviews.author: ANGIE D.

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit for older and newer electronics
customer_reviews.text: The unit works great- lots of HDMI connectors and I was able to attach my older projector and my new roku and speakers.
customer_reviews.author: SC Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Best deal ever for $300 on Black friday
customer_reviews.text: Great receiver ... Gives each speaker a great power and I definitely recommend it. The down part of it that the sub output is only a single plug and does not have left and right option like the pioneer receiver
customer_reviews.author: Houssam Alghadban

customer_reviews.title: my older analog yamaha amp was much better than this
customer_reviews.text: my older analog yamaha amp was much better than this. but i had to switch due to hdmi connections. low sound levels and poor sound quality compared to older analog model
customer_reviews.author: SSKV

customer_reviews.title: decent receiver.
customer_reviews.text: decent receiver. problem with sometimes having to turn on/off quickly to get hdmi volume to kick in from cable box
customer_reviews.author: GH

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver for money
customer_reviews.text: Before writing this review I actua wanted to make sure I used the system for awhile. I'm Happy to report high ratings! Very easy to use and all ports and plugs work seamless. Remote is a bite intimidating and you really don't need all the buttons available but after a while you ignore the ones not needed. Overall great receiver.
customer_reviews.author: LeroyLeyba

customer_reviews.title: For ONCE a product
customer_reviews.text: For once a product that is BETTER than expected ... and I expected a lot ... The finest, user friendly, great sounding home theater receiver on the market today. Zero frustration hooking it up and getting it running. Unlike the Denon product which takes a rocket science degree to get working. 5 STARS !!!
customer_reviews.author: Gary/Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Great sound; YPAO questionable
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an Onkyo I had. Sound quality is great. It was easy to set up. Wish network connection was wireless instead of wired or at least if there was an option to get wireless via USB. YPAO did not work for me - kept saying could not find rear speakers though sounds comes just fine.
customer_reviews.author: NM@MN

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: It has a very clear and dynamic sound. No disappointment here and would recommend to a friend. Was able to connect all of my gear and I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: robert mullins

customer_reviews.title: Got it on the Black Friday sale
customer_reviews.text: I could not be happier with this purchase. Got it installed and hooked up with banana clips. Sound is awesome and it has made switching between devices cake. I am using the 2 channel to power another room.
customer_reviews.author: M Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: awesome for pandora
customer_reviews.text: i have owned 3 generations of yamaha reciever i upgraded on a lighting deal and love it, control through your phone, pandora through your speakers controlled by your phone. awesome!!!!
customer_reviews.author: C. Baima

customer_reviews.title: Great for a low end reciever
customer_reviews.text: Bought if for my TV in the living room. It does a great job. Easy to use, Blue Ray, Cable, Stereo, Pandora etc. Only downside is it is a little under powered for a normal size room.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long!
customer_reviews.text: I waited over 2 years to upgrade my Yamaha HTR-5540 receiver, which did not have HDMI inputs, when I bought my new 52" HD TV. This new receiver is wonderful and allowed me to properly hook up my surround sound and HD TV. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: W. Eaton

customer_reviews.title: Broken after two years
customer_reviews.text: HDMI output failed resulting in flickering picture followed by no picture at all. It was good while it lasted but now comes the cost and hastle of trying to have this unit repaired.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kerlin

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha RX-V671
customer_reviews.text: Had a 15 year old Yamaha receiver which served me well but was unable to decode the new HD audio formats so decided to upgrade to this receiver. After much research and my past positive history with Yamaha I decided to pull the trigger on this unit and am absolutely delighted that I did. It worked flawlessly and setup was a breeze. I've had it about a month now and no issues whatsoever. Works as advertised. Would highly recommend this receiver!
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: amazing reciever and got it for an amazing price
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my dads new 7.1 setup all professionally installed in wall speakers and amazing speakers for the fronts and the sub a polk sub normally 800 bucks we got for 350 new sounds amazing and this reciever delivers on all levels just amazing and the auto setup did everything almost perfect only had to adjust 1 or 2 things. was more of a onkyo person but from now on i will always look into yamaha as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: I am using the RX-V671 for music only. Great sound quality. The enhancer function works great to decompress the audio files from my ipod. The CD player sounds very clean and clear. DVD concerts sound great, too. I still have to try the turntable to test the sound.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: Very nice receiver, but I should have looked at something ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice receiver, but I should have looked at something with airplay,,, I had to buy an Apple TV separately...
customer_reviews.author: Syed F. Jalal

customer_reviews.title: Got a great deal at the time and still love this receiver
customer_reviews.text: Got a great deal at the time and still love this receiver. Works great and Yamaha has periodic software updates which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Good product......as advertised....I have yet learned how to utilize the USB port. I am a novice. I pluged in my IPhone expecting to hear music, no sound....I guess I have to download the instructional contents of the disk in order to learn the proper sequence to produce sound. I thought I could avoid the misery of having to read the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: This device replaced a Denon, and provided a substantial boost in sound, quality, and features, as well as fully HDMI support.
customer_reviews.author: Casey DeLorme

customer_reviews.title: AV 7.1 Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Excellent receiver. It has all the bells and whistles at an excellent price. The Zone 2 option is a great perk, allowing me to hook additional speakers in another room. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Receiver
customer_reviews.text: After looking at more expensive models I decided to give it a try. One year later I have no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it turned itself off for good.
customer_reviews.text: Receiver has occasionally shut itself off. Today, after just two years, it finally started doing that over and over. After about 10 cycles of that, it turned itself off for good.
customer_reviews.author: MARSHAWN LYNCH

customer_reviews.title: Shipped Great - Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Everything I need in HDMI connections. Replacing an aged Yamaha unit. This is a fantastic home media center. Its an easy configuration as always. The sound is awesome and the features are what I need for Ipod connections, etc...
customer_reviews.author: D. Podschadel

customer_reviews.title: USB Defect
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for three years and now will not recognize anything put in the USB port. We can no longer play music from an iPad or iPod. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surround sound stereo
customer_reviews.text: Stereo don't sound as good as my old surround sound. Requires all new components, which I don't have. Will not play a Big Screen TV that is not Digital.
customer_reviews.author: Gstyle

customer_reviews.title: Flawless.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to replace a Denon. It works perfectly. I had no problems hooking it up after reading the instructions. The surround sound in my viewing room is amazing. Glad I bought this receiver.
customer_reviews.author: lavapig

customer_reviews.title: yamaha reciever
customer_reviews.text: love it, it is great to play from your pc, working to try playing it from my galaxy note 2 and 10 tablet too
customer_reviews.author: Wild4

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha RX-V671 7.1
customer_reviews.text: What can I say of this Receiver. I will never ever go back to using TV speakers. Very easy to use and being able to play my music from my PC great.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos Pelayo

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: I have owned yamaha receivers in the past and this one is easy to set up and use. The sound is good and the pass thru for HDMI works great.
customer_reviews.author: dlachn

customer_reviews.title: Replaced Onkyo
customer_reviews.text: It works fine (so far - two weeks old). It was simple to set up. Sounds fine. Love the iOS apps and the web interface. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RickyF

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver
customer_reviews.text: I have had this unit about a year and use it daily. It rocks! Performs as advertised in all ways.
customer_reviews.author: VFRdilbert

customer_reviews.title: Loving Life (So Far)
customer_reviews.text: Finalyl fulfilled a dream of having a decent suround sound system. This got combined with a 10' sub from Polk and 5 in wall speakers from Monoprice. Love all of the features that are included with this reciever. Still working with fine turning the sound, but so far its pretty good. Cant wait to get everything finalized. Keeping my fingers crossed. Will update if opinion changes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Simpkins

customer_reviews.title: It does everything that I want a Receiver to do ...
customer_reviews.text: It does everything that I want a Receiver to do. You do not even have to power it up to change the pass through.
customer_reviews.author: Dale L. Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this by debating a lot should I buy it online or should I go into store, but i am very satisfied with this product. This product is as good as it explains on Amazon site and we had great time at my son's bday thanks to Yamaha RX-V671 now this is will be our favorite for coming up parties.
customer_reviews.author: Harsimran Singh

customer_reviews.title: sweet and crisp sound and image quality
customer_reviews.text: Simply put... turned on the tv audio and then turned on the receiver! you can truly "feel" the difference, the sound is very crisp and clear, picture quality is awesome... using optical port for my 3d/blueray dvds, the sound can give you goose bumps. LOVE IT!!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Shah

customer_reviews.title: Rich Sound, Under Full Control
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of HDMI and other input options, scene setups, direct streaming from Pandora and other online sources, full range of frequency controls, automated setup microphone included, so forth and so on - this unit has it all. Well, most of it. There are higher end units from this company, but this one had every feature I was looking for and greatly improved my system's sound quality. I'm extremely pleased with the result of this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: G. Troutman

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic item an easy to st up. I love the sound and quality.Top notch product that lives up to its name
customer_reviews.author: N. Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Problems with HDMI resolution
customer_reviews.text: When passing the HDMI signal through the receiver, there are problems when resolution changes. More than once per minute there will be a screen flicker. In some cases, the on-screen menu will be chopped off at the bottom. I finally ended up running audio from my DVR to the receiver, and HDMI directly to the TV.
customer_reviews.author: K. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to replace an old receiver and so far I am happy. Haven't had a chance to use the full 7.1 (actually 7.2) features yet.
customer_reviews.author: XKR_XKE

customer_reviews.title: OMG
customer_reviews.text: I love this receiver. The options and quality of components this unit provides is awesome. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bitchin Stereo
customer_reviews.text: Nice receiver. This unit and a Russound Amp run our whole house audio set up. No complaints and the price was reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: AB10

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha Receiver
customer_reviews.text: This receiver replaced my Denon receiver. I wanted an upgrade with more HDMI inputs. The on screen programming of the Yamaha is very nice. It makes programming easy. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: 3saluki

customer_reviews.title: It's a Yamaha - what do you expect?
customer_reviews.text: I own Yamaha professional equipment for my main home and have always been impressed with functionality features and most important, sound quality. This unit had many of the professional features, like the digital balancing of sound levels for optimal playback. Great value, even better sound.
customer_reviews.author: Alan L.

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha RX - V671BL
customer_reviews.text: Item is well worth the price. It has all the features and proper amount if inputs. Clean and clear sound, easy operation. The remote has a complete set of buttons to operate each operation without having to push a single button multiple times to enter a certain field. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: hal e

customer_reviews.title: What I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: My three year old Onyko overheated and started getting HDMI switching problems. By by Onyko hello Yamaha. This jewel screams and sounds better balanced by far than the Onyko. Center speakers sound great where before some movies the dialogue I couldn't make out then it would get real loud with the music. Not any more. This baby rocks!
customer_reviews.author: pmrsed

product_meta.title: Yamaha RX-V671 7.1- Channel Network AV Receiver
product_meta.description:
Network AV Receiver with 6 in / 1 out HDMI ( 3D and ARC compatibility), iPhone/Android app compatibility, front panel HDMI and USB connections, HD Audio decoding with CINEMA DSP 3D, and 1080p upscaling. SIRIUS Satellite Radio ready. Front panel USB Digital Connection for iPod and iPhone. HDMI front panel input for devices such as camcorders and digital cameras. Audio input assign capability for HDMI and component video input. Ability to change HDMI Input while in Standby Through mode. 1080p-compatible HDMI: 6 inputs (1 on front) and 1 output. 2 - Zone,iPhone/Android app compatibility. Analog and HDMI video upscaling to full 1080p. HDMI and USM front panel connection. Network Receiver. iPhone/Android app compatibility.Power Requirements: 120V AC 60 Hz.2-Year Yamaha Limited Parts and Labor Warranty.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


The Yamaha RX-V671 7.1-Channel Audio/Video Receiver offers many advanced home theater features including 6-in/1-out HDMI with 3D and Audio Return Channel compatibility, HD Audio, and SCENE function. Bring movies and music to life with 7.1 channels of pure surround sound. The RX-V671 adds the power of intelligent front presence effects to your multichannel audio. Combined with Yamaha's advanced exclusive technologies such as CINEMA DSP and Adaptive Dynamic Range Control, you can enjoy the most immersive audio experience yet from your favorite entertainment. Use the included mic and Yamaha's YPAO Optimization setup wizard to make setting up your 7.1-channel system easy.

Amplifier flexibility is also a key feature of the RX-V671. You can add a second 2-channel stereo audio zone (Zone 2). Or, if you don't have a 7.1 speaker system, the receiver can be bi-amped to a pair of main front speakers.

Front panel USB Digital Connection for your iPhone and iPod
Use the on-screen GUI to make speaker set-up even easier. View larger
Six HDMI inputs supporting the latest technologies and Network Control. View larger
Enhance source video while up-scaling to 1080p with Adaptive Video Scaling. View larger USB DIGITAL CONNECTION FOR IPHONE AND IPOD ON THE FRONT PANEL 
A USB port on the front panel provides convenient connection for your iPhone/iPod, which also charges when connected. Because the digital signal from the iPhone/iPod is transmitted directly to the AV Receiver, noise interference is minimized and sound quality is iPhone/iPod much better.

Use the AV Controller app and enjoy internet music streaming. View App Screens
Enjoy the effects of CINEMA DSP surround sound without the surround speakers
Advanced technologies make the RX-V671 the center of your home theater. View larger USE IN A HOME NETWORK FOR MORE MUSIC, EASY CONTROL
This AV Receiver can be the control center of a home entertainment network connected to the internet. You can use the AV Controller app for control from an iPhone, etc., and enjoy music streaming from Pandora, Napster, Rhapsody and Sirius Internet Radio. It's also Windows 7 and DLNA 1.5 certified which allows access to music files on any computer or local NAS drive content available on your home network

IPHONE AV CONTROLLER APP
This AV Controller App will turn your iPhone/iPod touch/iPad into a Wi-Fi enabled remote control for the RX-V671. This App provides the flexibility to control input, volume, mute and power commands. You can browse content from all internally available sources such as Internet Radio, USB and AM/FM tuners. You can also control all AV Receiver zones such as powering on and changing input for each zone. It's great to have all this control at your fingertips.

ON-SCREEN ADVANCED GUI (GRAPHICAL USER INTERFACE)
Yamaha's latest Graphical User Interface has a high resolution display with clear, easy-to-use menus and also includes a selectable Status Bar that shows input source, volume level, DSP mode and audio format.

1080P-COMPATIBLE HDMI WITH 3D AND AUDIO RETURN CHANNEL
Improve your home cinema experience with 105 watts per channel of powerful 7.1-channel surround sound, with the latest HD Audio format decoding: Dolby TrueHD and DTS-HD Master Audio, Dolby Digital Plus, and DTS-HD High Resolution Audio. The 1080p-compatible HDMI (6 in/1 out) supports Deep Color (30/36 bit), x.v.Color, 24 Hz Refresh Rate and Auto Lip-Sync compensation, as well as the latest HDMI features like 3D and Audio Return Channel.

CINEMA DSP DIGITAL FOR ENHANCED SURROUND REALISM
Conventional multi-channel audio reproduction systems base their sound on Dolby Digital and DTS decoding, using matrix and steering technologies to create surround sound effects. Yamaha CINEMA DSP is much more advanced, actually creating richly realized independent sound fields that envelop you in an unmatched surround sound experience. With dialogue, music and effects ideally located in these separate sound fields, you will hear sound with accurate placement, smooth movement, exceptional clarity and richness, and startlingly realistic presence. It will seem as if the walls of your room have disappeared and you are in the middle of your own immense theater.

SILENT CINEMA AND VIRTUAL CINEMA DSP
SILENT CINEMA, a variation of Yamaha's CINEMA DSP technology, makes it possible to listen in private to movies and other multi-channel sources for hours without listening fatigue. Virtual CINEMA DSP lets you enjoy the effects of CINEMA DSP surround sound without using surround speakers (handy for use in custom installations where some rooms don't have surround speakers). It can be used with the front / center / presence speakers or even with just the two front left and right speakers.

ADAPTIVE DRC (DYNAMIC RANGE CONTROL)
Yamaha's Adaptive DRC technology automatically adjusts the dynamic range of the sound according to the volume that is selected. Adaptive DRC refines the dynamic range parameters to make low volume sounds easier to hear (narrower dynamic range) while retaining the massiveness felt during high volume (wider dynamic range). And because our ears lose sensitivity to low and high sounds as volume decreases, it continually adjusts these frequency ranges according to the volume and to the input signal level.

COMPRESSED MUSIC ENHANCER REFRESHES YOUR MUSIC
Yamaha employs sophisticated digital signal processing with exclusive algorithms to enable playback that improves the performance of compressed music formats, including MP3 and WMA. With the Compressed Music Enhancer, highs and especially lows are richer and smoother, bringing music back to life to be as close to the original as possible.

SCENE: A NEW LEVEL OF OPERATING EASE
Four SCENE buttons make operating the receiver easier than ever. They are initially set to default settings for DVD Viewing, Disc Listening, TV Viewing and Radio Listening. Push a SCENE button to automatically launch play of the preset source. Other SCENE settings are also available, such as iPod Listening, XM Listening, TV Sports Viewing and Action Game Playing. Browse and select the settings quickly accomplished by rotating the Input knob and watching the on-screen display. The settings can be selected for one-time use, or they can replace the original default settings. You can even change the SCENE names for convenience.

AUDIO DELAY COMPENSATION KEEPS YOUR EXPERIENCE ON TRACK
The latest display devices perform complex internal processing, causing time lag in the video signal. It is a small difference, but because the audio arrives first, the viewer may feel that something is not natural. The Audio Delay function for adjusting Lip-Sync matches the audio to the timing of the output of the video on the screen (0-240ms).

Included microphone designed for YPAO helps you easily set up your speaker system YPAO SOUND OPTIMIZATION
YPAO sound optimization for automatic speaker setup lets you set up your surround sound speakers simply and easily. An included microphone designed for YPAO will help you set up your speakers for optimal performance, no matter the room.


Auto Power Down after 4, 8 or 12 hours (selectable) and extremely low power consumption.

EXPAND YOUR YAMAHA SYSTEM WITH CONVENIENT CONNECTIVITY
The optional YDS-12 Universal Dock lets you connect your iPod or iPhone to the receiver. And the YDS-12 is "Works with iPhone"-certified, so you can get the most out of your iPhone music library with zero hassles.

The optional YID-W10 Wireless Dock System for iPod/iPhone ensures that you enjoy maximum sound quality and no lip sync (AV matching) problems.

The optional YBA-10 Bluetooth Wireless Audio Receiver docks to the receiver and supports A2DP stereo audio streaming, so users can enjoy music wirelessly from Bluetooth-enabled smartphones, Windows PCs, and Macs.

TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS
 * Power Output: 105W x 7 Banana-plug Compatible
 * Frequency Response: 10Hz - 100kHz +0,-3dB
 * Total Harmonic Distortion: 0.06%
 * Signal-to-Noise Ratio: 98dB
 * Standby Power Consumption (HDMI Off, Standby Through Off): 0.1W
 * Dimensions (WxHxD): 17-1/8" x 6-3/8" x 14-1/4"
 * Weight: 23.1 lbs

WHICH RX-V SERIES RECEIVER IS RIGHT FOR YOU?

RX-V371 
RX-V471 
RX-V571 
RX-V671 Power Output 100W x 5 105W x 5 105W x 7 105W x 7 HDMI Inputs 4 4 6 6 Front iPod Connection Graphic User Interface (GUI) Video Up-conversion Versatile Zone Control Network Control
(Incl. DLNA 1.5/ Win 7 Compatibility /
PANDORA / Rhapsody/ SIRIUS Internet Radio) Web Browser Control iPhone App
